properties.name: Visual Novel Example
properties.description: Create interactive stories with this GDevelop example. It has all that you need to make a basic Visual novel, dialog, button options, and much more.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetState

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Change the text of the button label.
eventsFunctions.name: SetLabelText

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label text.
eventsFunctions.name: LabelText

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label center Y according to the button configuration. This expression is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is pressed or released.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterWithPaddingY

eventsFunctions.description: Center the label according to the button configuration. This is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is resized.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterLabel

eventsFunctions.description: De/activate interactions with the button.
eventsFunctions.name: Activate

eventsFunctions.description: Check if interactions are activated on the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsActivated

propertyDescriptors.label: Label offset on Y axis when pressed
propertyDescriptors.name: PressedLabelOffsetY

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Westboy31
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FlashTransitionPainter
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Behavior for shape painter allows you to paint a color all over the screen for period of time with an effect (useful for simulate flash and transition effect).
description: * __Paint effect:__ Action to paint a color all over the screen for a period of time with specific effect.
* __Flash:__ is a monochrome color appear with fade then disappear with fade out.
* __Vertical:__ is a monochrome color comes from right side then comes back.
* __Horizontal:__ is a monochrome color come from top side then comes back.
* __Circular:__ is a circle which increases from the center and narrows.
* __Paint effect ended:__ event when the paint effect ends.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Paint all over the screen a color for a period of time.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FlashTransitionPainter

events.comment: Disable effect when the game starts.
Avoid default parameter of painter that could make the extension doesn't work.

Initialise position of painter. 
Increment or decrement "_TimeProgressionEffect" depending on direction.

Here this the paints functions of different effect depending on the type chosen by the user.
Detect the direction of the animation and its end.
Type 2 : screen come from top then return.
Type 3 : screen come from left then return.
Type 4 : a circle scale up from the middle then scale down.
The repeat 5 times is used to have clean and smooth edges , especially for circle.

eventsFunctions.description: Paint Effect.
eventsFunctions.name: PaintEffect
eventsFunctions.sentence: Paint effect type _PARAM4_ of _PARAM0_ with direction _PARAM5_ and color _PARAM2_ for _PARAM3_ seconds

events.comment:
Initialise all variables and then activate the behavior.
If user doesn't assign value to color and type , we take the last value registred.
If user doesn't assign value to timer we take a default value (0.2).

eventsFunctions.description: Paint effect ended.
eventsFunctions.name: PaintEffectIsEnd

events.comment: Detect when the animation ends with a timer which is initialised in PaintEffect function.

propertyDescriptors.label: The maximum of the opacity only for flash
propertyDescriptors.name: MaxOpacity

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
description: Shake an object (position, angle or scale).
- Object slowly rocking back and forth (like a ship)
- Simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
The top-down RPG example uses this extension for damage animations ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
This behavior can be used on any type of object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_.  Wait _PARAM6_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

eventsFunctions.description: Stop any shaking of object that was initiated by the Shake Object extension.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is shaking.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale)
This behavior can only be used on sprite objects.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_, and scale amplitude _PARAM6_.  Wait _PARAM7_ seconds between shakes.  Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM8_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amplitude of scale shake (in percent change)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerScale

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

eventsFunctions.description: Stop shaking an object.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is shaking.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy, daliyoucefmedakram@gmail.com, @bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Auto typing animation for text ("typewriter" effect)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AutoTyping
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Reveal a text one letter after the other.
description: Reveal a text one letter after the other (a "typewriter" effect).
It can be used for dialogue scenes or visual novels.
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Animate text to simulate it being written one character at at time (a "typewriter" effect).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Text_AutoTyping

eventsFunctions.description: Execute actions when the auto typing text ends.
eventsFunctions.name: TypingFinished

eventsFunctions.description: Detect if the auto typing is on pause.
eventsFunctions.name: TypingPause

eventsFunctions.description: Detect when a new text character is displayed. Useful for triggering sound effects.
eventsFunctions.fullName: New text character was just displayed
eventsFunctions.name: IsCharacterJustAdded
eventsFunctions.sentence: Text character was just displayed on _PARAM0_

eventsFunctions.description: Pause animation auto typing.
eventsFunctions.name: Pause

eventsFunctions.description: Resume auto typing after pause.
eventsFunctions.name: Resume

eventsFunctions.description: Skip to the end of the text.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Skip to the end of the text
eventsFunctions.name: SkipToEnd

eventsFunctions.description: Jump to a specific position in the text. Positions start at "0" and increase by one for every character.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Jump to a specific position in the text
eventsFunctions.name: JumpToPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Jump to position _PARAM2_ in the text _PARAM0_

eventsFunctions.description: Start at the beginning of text. When the text changes, the automatic typing starts again from the beginning with the new text.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Start at the beginning of the text
eventsFunctions.name: StartAtBeginning

eventsFunctions.description: Change the time between characters being typed.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeInterval
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the interval between characters of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Return the text character that was last displayed.
eventsFunctions.name: CurrentCharacter

eventsFunctions.description: Return the index of the text character that was last displayed.
eventsFunctions.name: CurrentCharacterIndex

propertyDescriptors.label: Detect if a new text character was just displayed
propertyDescriptors.name: CharacterJustAdded

propertyDescriptors.label: Text character that was most recently displayed
propertyDescriptors.name: CurrentCharacter
